channel.title: R on Badran Elshenawy
channel.description: Recent content in R on Badran Elshenawy

item.title: Mastering Bulk RNA-seq Analysis – Post 8: Volcano Plot Mastery!
item.description: Transform your differential expression results into compelling volcano plots that tell clear biological stories. Discover the color coding strategy that emphasizes statistical confidence first, advanced interactive techniques, and how to avoid the common pitfalls that make volcano plots unreadable.

item.title: Mastering Bulk RNA-seq Analysis – Post 7: Differential Expression Analysis!
item.description: The climactic moment of RNA-seq analysis! Discover how DESeq2’s three-step statistical process identifies truly differentially expressed genes, learn to interpret results like a pro, and avoid the common pitfalls that can derail your biological discoveries.

item.title: Mastering Bulk RNA-seq Analysis – Post 6: Data Transformations
item.description: Discover why normalized counts still aren’t ready for PCA and clustering, and how VST and rlog transformations solve the variance problem. Learn to choose the right transformation method and integrate it properly into your RNA-seq workflow.

item.title: Mastering Bulk RNA-seq Analysis – Post 5: Normalization Methods
item.description: Discover how normalization transforms meaningless raw counts into biologically interpretable expression values. Explore DESeq2’s robust median-of-ratios method and learn to identify normalization issues that could derail your analysis.

item.title: Mastering Bulk RNA-seq Analysis – Post 4: Experimental Design & Count Matrix Setup
item.description: Discover how experimental design determines the success of your RNA-seq analysis. Explore common design patterns, sample size guidelines, and best practices for handling complex experimental factors while avoiding the pitfalls that derail many analyses.

item.title: Mastering Bulk RNA-seq Analysis – Post 3: Data Import & Preprocessing
item.description: Bridge the gap between theory and practice by mastering RNA-seq data import and preprocessing. Discover step-by-step workflows for creating DESeqDataSet objects, handling different input formats, and performing essential quality checks before analysis.

item.title: Mastering Bulk RNA-seq Analysis – Post 2: DESeq2 Fundamentals
item.description: Demystify DESeq2’s statistical framework with clear explanations designed for both experimentalists and bioinformaticians. Discover why count data requires specialized methods and how DESeq2’s approach transforms messy RNA-seq data into trustworthy biological insights.

item.title: Mastering Bulk RNA-seq Analysis – Post 1: Introduction
item.description: Discover the complete roadmap for mastering bulk RNA-seq analysis in R. This series introduction outlines a 10-post journey from foundational concepts to advanced applications, building on genomic data structures to solve real biological questions through differential expression analysis.

item.title: Foundations of Genomic Data – Post 13: SummarizedExperiment
item.description: Discover how SummarizedExperiment serves as the culminating container of the Bioconductor ecosystem, elegantly combining GRanges, DataFrame, and assay matrices into a unified object that ensures synchronized, reproducible genomic analyses across diverse experimental types.

item.title: Foundations of Genomic Data – Post 12: ShortRead
item.description: Discover how ShortRead serves as the crucial starting point for genomic data analysis, providing comprehensive tools for importing, assessing, and preprocessing raw sequencing reads before they flow into the structured Bioconductor analysis pipeline.

item.title: Foundations of Genomic Data – Post 11: rtracklayer
item.description: Discover how rtracklayer serves as the critical bridge between the diverse world of genomic file formats and Bioconductor’s analytical environment. Explore efficient techniques for importing, exporting, and converting between formats with a consistent interface that simplifies genomic workflows.

item.title: Foundations of Genomic Data – Post 10: plyranges
item.description: Discover how plyranges revolutionizes genomic data analysis by bringing tidyverse principles to Bioconductor. Explore how pipes, filters, joins and group operations make complex genomic analyses more readable, maintainable, and accessible while seamlessly connecting two powerful R ecosystems.

item.title: Foundations of Genomic Data – Post 9: Biostrings
item.description: Explore how Biostrings revolutionizes biological sequence analysis in R with 2-bit encoding for DNA/RNA, specialized pattern matching algorithms, and seamless integration with the Bioconductor ecosystem for everything from basic manipulations to complex genomic analyses.

item.title: Foundations of Genomic Data – Post 8: DataFrame
item.description: Explore how the S4 DataFrame powers the Bioconductor ecosystem by enabling storage of complex genomic objects, providing familiar data.frame-like syntax, and offering enhanced performance for large-scale genomic analyses.

item.title: Foundations of Genomic Data – Post 7: GenomicAlignments
item.description: Explore the power of GenomicAlignments for working with sequence alignment data in R. Learn to import BAM/SAM files, extract biological insights, and integrate with the broader Bioconductor ecosystem.

item.title: Foundations of Genomic Data – Post 6: GRangesList
item.description: Explore the power of GRangesList for grouped genomic analyses. Learn to create, access, and operate on multiple GRanges objects in a unified, memory-efficient structure.

item.title: Foundations of Genomic Data – Post 5: GRanges
item.description: Explore how GRanges adds chromosomes, strand, and metadata to IRanges. Learn to build, manipulate, and analyze GRanges for high-throughput genomic workflows in Bioconductor.

item.title: Foundations of Genomic Data – Post 4: IRanges
item.description: Master IRanges in R for efficient genomic interval operations. Learn with examples how IRanges powers GRanges, ChIP-Seq analysis, and coverage workflows in Bioconductor.

item.title: Foundations of Genomic Data – Post 3: S4 Objects
item.description: Master the S4 object system in R and its critical role in Bioconductor and Seurat. Learn how structure, type safety, and modularity enable scalable genomic analysis.

item.title: Foundations of Genomic Data – Post 2: Rle Vectors
item.description: Master the Rle class in R and understand how run-length encoding saves memory in genome-scale data analysis. Learn with examples and real use cases in Bioconductor.

item.title: Tidyverse Series – Post 14: Bringing It All Together – A Full Tidyverse Workflow
item.description: Master the power of combining Tidyverse packages for a complete data analysis workflow. Learn how dplyr, tidyr, ggplot2, and more work together for seamless analysis.

item.title: Tidyverse Series – Post 13: The Power of Piping
item.description: Master piping in the Tidyverse with %>% and the new native |> operator in R. Learn how to streamline data wrangling and visualization workflows.

item.title: Tidyverse Series – Post 12: Handling Big Data Efficiently with Arrow & Parquet
item.description: Master big data handling in R with Arrow & Parquet. Learn how to optimize data storage, querying, and performance for large datasets.

item.title: Tidyverse Series – Post 11: Working with Databases in the Tidyverse using dbplyr
item.description: Master database workflows in R with dbplyr. Learn to query, manipulate, and optimize large datasets in databases using Tidyverse syntax.

item.title: Tidyverse Series – Post 10: String Manipulation Made Easy with stringr
item.description: Master text processing in R with stringr. Learn efficient ways to detect, extract, replace, and manipulate text for data analysis.

item.title: Tidyverse Series – Post 9: Functional Programming in R with purrr
item.description: Master functional programming in R with purrr. Learn to map, reduce, and iterate over data structures efficiently in the Tidyverse.

item.title: Tidyverse Series – Post 8: Handling Dates & Times with lubridate
item.description: Master date and time manipulation in R with lubridate. Learn how to efficiently parse, extract, and compute time-based calculations in the Tidyverse.

item.title: Tidyverse Series – Post 7: Importing & Handling Data Efficiently with readr
item.description: Master data import in R with readr. Learn to load, clean, and process large datasets efficiently using modern Tidyverse tools.

item.title: Tidyverse Series – Post 6: Handling Categorical Data with forcats
item.description: Master categorical data manipulation in R with forcats. Learn to reorder, lump, recode, and handle missing factor levels efficiently with real-world examples.

item.title: Tidyverse Series – Post 5: Data Joins & Merging with dplyr
item.description: Master dataset merging with dplyr joins in R. Learn about inner, left, right, full, semi, and anti joins, with practical examples and handling missing data.

item.title: Tidyverse Series – Post 4: The Power of Tidy Data
item.description: Discover how tidy data simplifies data wrangling, visualization, and analysis in R with the Tidyverse. Learn how to reshape and clean data efficiently.

item.title: Tidyverse Series – Post 3: Reshaping & Cleaning Data with tidyr
item.description: Discover how tidyr makes data reshaping and cleaning in R simple, readable, and efficient with functions like pivot_longer, pivot_wider, separate, unite, and more.

item.title: Tidyverse Series – Post 2: Mastering Data Manipulation with dplyr
item.description: Discover how dplyr makes data manipulation in R simple, readable, and efficient with five key verbs: select, filter, mutate, arrange, and summarize.

item.title: Tidyverse Series – Post 1: Why the Tidyverse is a Game-Changer for R
item.description: Discover why the Tidyverse is a game-changer for data science in R, simplifying data wrangling, visualization, and reproducibility.
